author: tbrandenburg
content:
[Issue] Show command or tool outputs

Hej guys,

does somebody from you know how to display the actual STDOUT from tools or command line commands?

Claude Code has a keyboard shortcut for that:
https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/interactive-mode
Ctrl+O: Toggle verbose output (Shows detailed tool usage and execution)

It is very hard to judge to see what is going on "under the hood" without seeing the output, especially when debugging.

Is there an equivalent in droid CLI?

Thanks!

author: 0zl
content:
[Issue] Compiled CLI Binary Fails to Run on Older CPUs

The Droid/Factory CLI compiled binary appears to be built with Bun for Haswell CPU architecture, which lacks support for older CPUs. Running `droid` produces no output and force-closes. Providing a `baseline`[^1] build flavor would resolve this. Maybe.

Potentially related issues: #111, #156, #170, #184.

[^1]: https://bun.com/docs/installation#cpu-requirements-and-baseline-builds

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] Release v1.3.220

---

This release brings HTTP MCP server support, a `/compress` command to optimize your context usage and droid exec for CDE.

---

## HTTP MCP Server Support

Factory now supports streamable HTTP-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers in addition to stdio-based servers. This enables you to connect to MCP servers running as web services, making it easier to integrate with cloud-hosted tools and services.

When adding an MCP server, Factory automatically detects whether it's HTTP o

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.16.0 Release Notes

- Sonnet 4.5 model is now available
- Clear chat input using double ESC or Ctrl-C
- User-configured allow and deny list of commands to execute
- Option to disable droid commit co-authoring
- Auth using FACTORY_API_KEY
- Fixed UI bugs due to resizing

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.7.0 Release Notes

CLI Release (0.7.0)

- Autonomy level selection: Users can now select any preferred autonomy level when confirming the ExitSpec tool
- Claude reasoning support: Added support for Claude's reasoning capabilities
- Session resumption: Users can now resume existing sessions when operating in Exec Mode
- Image reading capabilities: The CLI can now read and process images

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.5.0 Release Notes

v0.5 release:

- Users can now queue messages while the Droid works
- Added clearer autonomy level & mode descriptions
- Fixed many flickering issues
- Revamped `--help` command
- Automatic VSCode / Cursor / Windsurf CLI detection,
- Windows delete key bug fixed
- Lots of small UI improvements
- Lots of quality of life and bug fixes

coming soon:
- custom droids/subagents
- notif sounds
- much more

any requests?

author: fredrivett
content:
[Discussion] Hacked a lil hit counter for my site in a day w/ droid

The man @bentossell gave me access to droid last week, and I had the urge to add a retro hit counter to my site, so it was the perfect opportunity to test it out.

By the evening I'd gone back and forth on the tech, built it out and deployed it, with the widget live [on my site](https://www.fredrivett.com/).

It's live here: https://www.herenow.fyi/
And I've since split out the core code into this open source repo so anyone can set their own up: https://github.com/fredrivett/here-now

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] Factory Release 1.6

## To-do list tool, improved remote Droids, and browser tools

Factory 1.6 introduces a new To-Do List Tool for multi-step work, several improvements to remote Droids, plus Browser Tools to navigate and interact with the web from Factory.


### To-do list tool

Keep longer tasks on track. The to-do list tool creates a live checklist that Droids follow and update as work progresses.

 **How it works**

Droids break a goal into ordered tasks with clear acceptance criteria. Progress is t

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] Factory Release 1.5

## Session Revamp & Workflow Upgrades

Factory 1.5 introduces a fully redesigned Session interface, transforming how you manage your Droids.


### Session Revamp

The entire agentic workflow in Sessions has been rebuilt and simplified to reduce friction and keep you in control:

- **Specification:** Start with a distraction-free, chat-only workspace to define scope, boundaries, and success criteriaâ€”without side panels stealing focus.
- **Management:** Open the Context view to see exact

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] Factory Release 1.4

## Droids in Slack & UX Upgrades

Factory 1.4 introduces Droids into Slack and delivers key improvements to onboarding and overall user experience. 


### Slack Support

Droids can now read and write to your channels streamlining team workflows.

#### How it works

Connect your Slack workspace via the **Settings** page in Factory. Next, add the Factory app to any channel by typing **/invite** Factory in Slack. Once connected, Droids can see your channels, read conversations, and send
